titre: Phone ruined, pictures lost, headache to deal with this company
comment: My phone had a cracked screen. A technician came to fix it. He lost track of a screw and ended up damaging the battery. All the pictures and videos on the phone were lost forever. The technician took full blame for the accident and told me Asurion would be replacing the phone for free. He gave me a number to call and I called it. The first agent I talked to reassured me the phone would be paid for and to email in the appropriate documents. I did just that. I got a call to verify shipping. I was told I owed $200 for a new phone. I spoke with 4 or 5 different people who did not communicate with each other and I kept being told I had to pay $200 and send the old phone back (which I did not have). I finally got someone to understand what happened and they verified my shipping address and finally sent me a replacement phone for free. But they sent it to the wrong address. Not only did I get my phone ruined and lost all the memories with it, I had to deal with all these frustrations due to poor communication between the technician and each customer service agent. Needless to say, I cancelled my Asurion plan and will no longer be using their service. Apple Care is way better and cheaper anyway.

comment: One of our phones started having poor call handling. What's a phone that can cannot do calls... We were actually glad to have the insurance. The experience was completely unexpected and very customer focused. After struggling 2 years with a difficult phone I was excited to get a new one, while traveling on business I lost my phone (bummer).  I waited for the phone to be recovered and returned however, no response. While reviewing my phone bill I learned of the Asurion coverage and in 24 hours I had a new phone "hallelujah". The customer service agent was extremely attentive walking me through every step and handling the activation process, repeatedly expressing their apologies for my missing phone. I have told and will tell this story over and over again my Asurion experience was amazing.  You don't get many "positive" customer service stories to tell now, so I encourage you to not fiddle with a good thing. Asurion is fabulous!Greg DeShields

My purse was stolen from my gym locker 4/26/18 and I  lost so much including my Samsung Galaxy S5 cellphone. When I  finally got home that night about 9:30 PM, I  called Verizon right away. I was transferred to Asurian because of my insurance. I tried to give a check to pay the  $89 deductible over the phone but it would not work for some reason. (My bank the next day did not know why.) I hung up that night but found one credit card not in my stolen wallet so called Asurian back. The payment went through. This was Thursday night. On Saturday my new to me Samsung Galaxy S7 was delivered to my door. Now that is some great service!  Thank you, Asurian so much!
It was delivered to my home less than 12 hours after placing a claim, very satisfied

titre: The person I initially talked to atâ€¦
comment: The person I initially talked to at Asurion was great. However, i was met with a very time consuming road block in the first few minutes of trying to activate the new phone. It wanted me to put in an authorization code that could only be sent to that phone or an authorized phone. The phone I was replacing was broken, therefore I COULDN'T receive the code, and I didn't realize if I had an "authorized" phone on my account that would have solved to problem.  I tried calling Asurion for help, but was put on hold for about 20 minutes. I then called Apple for help, finally after about 2 hours of working through a very confusing process we finally achieved success.
Fast shipping. .thanks

This was probally one of the most upsetting experiences that i have ever had. I spent $250 dollars thinking that i would recieved a phone that was already actvated. When i got the phone it would not connect to the network so i called sprint. I sat on the phone with sprint for an hour only to be told that i was sent a phone that was associated with another phone number and told that i needed to contact asurion. At this point i was furious! I called asurion and talked with their representative where i was informed that there was nothng they could do until the next day becuase the office that handles the matter was closed. I called the next day when i got to work. The called took about 40 mintues of my morning in which i was told in needed to submitted my ID and additional paperwork in which the already had. At that point the repersentative called the claims adjuster who verified they had the documents need to process my claim. Then the line went blank. I have to call asurion 4 different times back to back to get the issue solved. It's currently four days later and i still have no working phone. I was told that the claim had been processed manually and there is no tracking number which means at day 4 it has not yet been shipped. Also i was given a range of 1-3 days before i would gwt the device. This is by far the worst costumer service i have ever recieved but whats even worse than that is that I'm sure no one will have to answer for this mess up. How do we aviod this happening to other costumers? If there was another insuance company i would certainly drop them.

titre: The experience with Asurion was fine
comment: The experience with Asurion was fine. The employees were curtious and helpful in replacing the phone. I received a refurbished phone a model newer. That was the only way they could check.My only complaint was that although the cracked screen repair for $29.00 was an option on my policy, I still had to spend $150.00 to replace my phone, because there were no repair places anywhere close to my home that I could discover. I had to keep searching by zip code trying to find a place. I spent a lot of time searching. It would have been better if the company could have a list of repair companies available, or if employees could have a list by state. I would have been willing to send the phone to a place relatively close.There are repair places in my town, but not on the Asurion list.

I got my phone stolen on May 8th today is the 15th and it's suppose to be next day delivery with insurance, but the phone is on back order. They never tell you that the phone you receive is not only refurbished, but also they don't guarantee the same color. They told me it would take 3-5 business days when in backorder, however after going on the website it showed 7-14 days. I spoke to a representative and she said it could take longer than 14 days, it all depends when they get in "new" phones. Another day I called back and had someone tell me they had gotten in new phones two days prior to me calling. However it still showed backorder on the website. Not to mention when I asked if it's always like this the lady laughed and said "Oh I don't know what happened, it's probably because it's spring break".Everyone I spoke to gave me different information that was not helpful and I still haven't received my phone. My advice is if you're thinking about if insurance is worth it, not with Asurion.

When I asked how long until we received our second replacement iPhone she said in a few days (it was a Monday night) and I had asked if it could be overnight. She said we don't do that! Then she told me I need to send back one of the iphones immediately back to them (the broken one and the T-Mobile one)!  I was feeling blamed for their mistake and never was apologized to. I needed to repair the screen on my current cellphone so I could trade it in for a brand new phone. The equipment Asurion sent the tech with was faulty and the only way to replace the screen was to destroy the old one. After the tech was finished, my phone was less functional than before and could still not be traded in. Upon calling Asurion to report the failed repair I was informed they could not send anyone else out to fix it BUT I could pay a small fee of $120 to replace the whole phone. I had previously paid $30 for a failed screen replacement and did not feel like wasting any additional money on this company's subpar service. It took an hour of phone time (calling from someone else's phone because mine was unusable) to finally get a reasonable resolution to the problem, one that didn't cost me a ton more money to resolve a problem their lousy equipment made worse. I should say that the tech was efficient and polite and the company (and their policies and their fees and their telephone customer service) are pretty pathetic. I am deeply saddened that should my current phone be damaged I will have to deal with them again.

titre: I'd give them no stars if I could
comment: I'd give them no stars if I could.  On 4/22 I filed an online claim on my phone.  After receiving no further information, on 4/23 I called and was told my claim had been denied because my phone was "malfunctioning" and not "broken."  When the agent asked for a description, I mentioned a crack in my screen and he indicated, "The crack is likely the cause of your touch screen no longer working.  Screen cracks can cause other, more significant phone problems."  So, I scheduled a repair for the soonest date, 4/27.   At 9:10 am on 4/27, I received an email from a colleague of mine in another building on campus telling me that the repair technician was there and asking what building I was in.  I told her and she gave him directions - get back on the ONLY road and go straight towards the clock tower.  You'll drive around a big grassy oval and the mansion that is on the oval, that's the building."  It's two buildings over from her - a 5 minute walk.  A 10 minute drive if you have trouble parking - or, if you drove straight in the wrong direction, in which case, you would have to make a right turn and then another right in order to head toward the clock tower and grassy oval.  I went downstairs and stood in front of my building - for the next 40 minutes.  It's a one-way road, with a 5 mph speed limit.  He did not drive past me.  The campus is under video surveillance, so I actually have video proof that he did not drive past the building, which, if he had followed the directions he was given, he would have been forced to do (due to the one way streets on campus.)  After 40 minutes, I came to my office and contacted Asurion who told me that the technician couldn't locate me and couldn't get me on my phone (because it's broken!)  They said that no one could come back today, but someone could come tomorrow.  I explained that this is my job, I won't be here on the weekend, but I would be taking an elderly family member to dialysis, doing their banking, shopping, taking my son to soccer, etc. - in other words, I won't be at a location for any 3 hour window tomorrow.  They then said I could get a replacement phone, for an additional $60 above what I'd already paid for a repair visit that didn't happen.  I refused, demanding either a same day repair visit or a replacement for the cost of the non-visit.  They refused.  After a bit more discussion about the status of my phone, the service agent said, "If your phone is not working, the tech couldn't repair the screen anyway."  THIS IS LITERALLY THE OPPOSITE OF WHAT THE FIRST SERVICE REP SAID ON TUESDAY.  The one who encouraged me to get the screen repaired so that the phone would start to work again.

The process worked well.  However a suggestion.  When I called to file the claim I stated that the issue was that my phone screen was cracked.  I was then directed to complete the process to replace the phone.  When the new phone arrived, in the process of chsnging phones, I open a box a 2 screen protectors.  I found them to be hard plastic.  I stopped & rexamined my old phone. I noted that I had a similar screen on it.  I then removed it to discover the cracks on my phone were to the protective screen & not the phone screen.  I then called & made arrangements to return the new ohone. In this process I learned that my situation is not uncommon.  I would therefore suggest that when someone calls in a claim related to a cracked screen that they be asked if they have a protective screen on their phone & if so have they removed it to see if the cracks weee to the protective screen rather than the phone.

Fast and professional.  I had been using my LG G3 for three years.  When the screen started failing, I went to Verizon to see if they could recommend a fix.  The tech recommended I contact Asurion because as he said, my phone was near the end of it's "life cycle".  I went through the website and was upgraded to a G6 since there were no G3's available.  I received the phone in the mail within 24 hours and was reconnected and working within minutes.

My Galaxy S7 developed a crack in its screen. It was hard to see but ran across about two inches of the upper right side. I called Asurion and was immediately shipped a replacement S7 and an envelope for the return of my damaged one. While on the phone they passed me over to another tech who made sure my old phone was set-up for copying and back-up so I could immediately start using my replacement. It all went very smoothly. A few apps had to be downloaded again and I had to log in again on some of them, but I was back online quickly.Remember that you have a 'deductible', but the bulk of the cost is covered. Also, I received a free year of Asurion coverage for the new one. All-in-all, a worthwhile coverage.
Once again, Asurion came through when one of the kids lost their phone.

titre: I've had an ongoing claim sinceâ€¦
comment: I've had an ongoing claim since December. For no reason should this experience have taken as long as it has. Ive had two seperate people push my claim through to a customer service team with the promise of a phone call in 24-48 hours to sort out the issue, i've not recieved either of these phone calls. I've done everything they have requested and still no closer to having the matter resolved. I am suppose to be sent a cheque for a relatively small amount, however i feel they are holding out as long as possible so I will not continue to pursue the issue. Im at a loss for what i can do. I'd advise to be very wary of doing business with this organization.

titre: The replacement of my phone was seamless. But...
comment: The replacement of my phone was cost effective and seamless.The new phone, for whatever reason, keeps offering services I don't want to use. Many times for each service I've already rejected.Perhaps my provider is causing this, not your replacement service,  but my previous phone didn't do this.
Initial replacement device was broken, head no ability to place or receive calls, something to do with the sound.Second device does not have the best battery life.

Horrible experience.  In short, it was 4 weeks of no-shows/no-calls, not ordering the part until a week after the initial no-show appointment, promises of part availability, later claims of that same part being unavailable, more no-shows/no-calls, call transfers, and on and on. Tried to upsell me to the replacement (higher deductible) for a simple fix every time, but miraculously found the part when fraud is mentioned.  This is a scam to upsell you and drag out your subscription, pure and simple.  Would've been far cheaper to purchase the kit myself than to carry insurance and deal with this.  The silver lining is that I never have to deal with them again.

My wifeâ€™s iPhone died in January of 2017.  She used her Asurion warranty and few days later a â€œnewâ€ phone appeared.   Great â€“ expect that the quality of the refurbished phone was not up to par and didnâ€™t quite work correctly.   Dropped calls, blacked out screen, calls straight to voicemail, the phone was obviously a lemon.   So onto phone #2 in February â€“ this one worked a little better, it lasted until December of 2017.   Call it 10 months, then it starts to hit the skids.  Quits working.   Get another phone through Asurion while paying an additional â€œdeductibleâ€ plus monthly fees.    This phone lasts from December 2017 to April of 2018 and then promptly dies.    I take the phone into a local repair shop who informs me the motherboard is defective.   Call the company, and the representative (who was nice by the way) informs us the warranty is for 1 year before talking to a boss and learning the warranty has been moved down to 90 days.   Great move by a management â€“ why give a warranty on something that in my experience works properly for more than 1 year exactly 0% of the time. At this point, we give up and buy a new iPhone.   I would have been better off buying a new iPhone, getting a manufacturerâ€™s warranty, then paying monthly for this insurance option plus having to pay deductibles.   In my experience the refurbished phones that Asurion provides of extremely low quality and are unlikely to last more than 6 months.   While Apple is providing the funds to Asurion, there has to be some sort of quality control program in place to ensure they are replacing customerâ€™s phones with suitable replacements, but in my experience they are not.  Maybe I am one in million with my experience, but I doubt it.   I believe Asurion knows they are sending out poor quality replacement phones that they are acquiring a lower cost than what actual replacement phones should cost.

titre: I received my fist replacement and itâ€¦
comment: I received my fist replacement and it was a locked for another carrier (sasktel phone for a telus customer). Spent many hours on the phone and they wouldn't do anything for me until I printed their paperwork and signed it and sent it back to them and gave them my credit card again.  Second replacement arrived and was another locked phone for a different carrier and again went through hell and didn't get anywhere.  At this point I have two unusable phones sent to me and getting terrible customer service.  So after being screwed around finally I got a call and the girl said " we will send you a cheque for the purchase amount of the phone on the Telus website".  So I went on the telus website and found it and the price was $904 plus tax.  I agreed to take the offer and then I received a cheque for a lesser amount.  I thought it was a mistake so I contacted them again (at this point I'm after sending them my damaged phone and the 2 unusable replacement phones).  They ask me to email them the link to the telus website where the phone and price was listed so I did.  They said that the device is currently not available for purchase so we gave you the price of simular phone that was available which is listed for less.  I said that I didn't agree to those terms and they didn't care and said that that's all I was going to get.  This battle isn't over yet. They made me feel like I was a liar so I told them to listen to their recorded phone call to confirm that the agreement that I said was actually true. My advice to everyone would be to find a different company for coverage of you need it.  Unfortunately the lowest rating I can give is one star,  there should be negative star ratings for companies like this.

If you want a replacement, no problem.. If you want a repair, good luck!  I cracked my screen on a 5 month old phone, and cannot get it fixed.  My repair deductible just went down to $49, but there is no way to do that.  I checked my zip code, and I am apparently not in the eligible area.  I checked all the zip codes within 50 miles of me, with no luck.  I checked a city that I am going to next week, no luck.  Curiously, I checked zip codes all throughout NEW YORK CITY and they can't even repair it in the most populated city in the country.  THIS HAS TO BE A SCAM RIGHT?!? I am absolutely furious that I pay for this service every month, am advertised that my deductible went down, and then realize that they cannot even do what they say they can do.  So instead of the $49 that I am advertised to fix my perfectly good working phone, I am forced to get a replacement for $225.  That is just not right...

titre: I am not even sure what to title thisâ€¦
comment: I am not even sure what to title this email. Maybe call it â€œfrustratedâ€, or â€œdoes anyone really careâ€, or even â€œyou win, I give up.â€ No matter what I title the email, the facts of my complaint still stand. I hope you will take a moment to read this email and by the time you reach the end, I hope you are shaking your head in disbelief and understand my level of frustration with the services AT&T and Asurion have provided.Providing a slight background, my family switched to AT&T recently after 20 years or more with Verizon. We switched in hopes of better service, more features and better overall value. We especially like the insurance package offered by AT&T through Asurion. We signed on and insured 4 cells phones and two devices to be named later. All was well I thoughtâ€¦ Unfortunately, my first and only claim has turned into a nightmare. When my contracts are up, I will be forced to seek another carrier based solely on Asurionâ€™s poor customer service, lies, false promises and unresponsivenessâ€¦ I will be spending some of my days posting how poor an Insurance provider Asurion is and how AT&T got me to them. So the story starts off several months ago when my German Shepard puppy decided to see how the outside of my Ipad Mini 2 tasted and proceed to crack the screen in a few places. I then figured out that the Ipad would be one of two unnamed devices associated with my phone insurance policy provided by Asurion. I completed the forms and received a box to ship my Ipad off to Asurion in hopes and quick repairs and a fully functioning Ipad. After days after shipping my Ipad to Asurion, I got it back with a new screen and s couple of cosmetic teeth marks still in the back of the Ipad. I quickly went to turn on my Ipad and soon discovered that the home button was not working correctlyâ€¦After a week or two, I contacted Asurion through the on-line chat feature. I chatted with one of Asurionâ€™s representatives who offered to send me a replacement Ipad. I questioned the replacement of the Ipad but was assured that Asurion would send me a new one and all I had to do was return the old one (with the malfunctioning home button) to Asurion within 10 days. I said great, lets do it and the representative ended our conversation with a promised new Ipad being delivered to my residence. A day or two later, I received a box in the mail that seemed awfully light. I opened the box to discover that it was simply a box to return my Ipad to Asurion for the second time. A little baffled, I reviewed the chat conversation between Asurion and I and was puzzled that I had not received a new Ipad. I contacted Asurion, a was told that the representative should not have said that and that they would not stand behind their promise of replacing the Ipad. I escalated the call and was told the same thing, basically we know what we said, and we know you have it in writing, but Asurion is not going to honor their commitment to replace the Ipad you will simply have to ship it back. For my troubles, they provided a small gift card, not a refund or an amount to cover the deductible that AT&T quickly charged me for. The Ipad was once again shipped back to Asurion.I received notification that Asurion had received my Ipad, fixed it and returned it to me all in the same day. Somewhat impress, I looked forward to getting my Ipad back all repaired, even against the promises that were made in writing by Asurion. When I got my Ipad back I was shocked. The Ipad still had a malfunctioning home button but now I was able to see the inner workings of the Ipad because the screen was not attached properly. I then called Asurionâ€™s customer service line. My level of frustration only continued to grow as I was put on hold, transferred, put on hold and then told no supervisor would take a call from me. I was simply told I would have to send the Ipad back for a THIRD time. I did get the obligatory and with not heart felt sentiment â€œI am sorryâ€ from your customer service person, but really, they arenâ€™t sorry and they did very little to resolve my frustration. I would now be required to return to the UPS store for the third time and after more than six weeks, I still didnâ€™t have a fully functioning Ipad. I posted an on-line review of my experiences with Asurion and received an email back asking for my information so that a representative from Asurion could reach out to me to try and resolve the issue. I provided my contact information several times and eventually (about 4 or five days later). Someone finally called me, left a voice and provided no information to contact them back at. This happened another time with the same information. I finally received a call from Stephen Ward with Asurion, on March 23rd, the same day I shipped my Ipad back for the THIRD time. I even stuck the repair order physically inside of my Ipad so they could see the screen was not attached. Stephen made promises that he would make this situation right and would do everything in his power to resolve my frustrations. Stephen asked for a day or two to speak with others about what had occurred. When I had not heard from him for several more day I contacted him and left a series of voicemails. Mr. Ward finally returned the call stating that he was still working on it, but again assured me he would make it right. This was nearing the end of the next week and I still did not have my Ipad or any answers. The following week I reached out to Stephen by email and voicemail and still had no answers from him. He did not return emails and often I had to leave 2 or 3 voicemails before he would call me back. Stephen was not fixing the situation, he was simply making it worse. Finally, I spoke with Stephen, who still had no definitive answers and I set a deadline for him to provide an answer before I would file more complaints about Asurion and AT&T. Stephen called me back the same day and offered me a settlement (payout) for my Ipad. Instead of fighting this anymore, I agreed to the settlement offer. That was more than a week ago. In this time, I have repeatedly asked Stephen for a confirmation email or a tracking number as he said the check would be sent immediately using Fedex. I have continued to ask for this information by both email and voicemail. I have yet to receive a response from Asurion. I am reaching out to you for help. I am frustrated, angry, disappointed, lied to, and have been disrespected by Asurion and their employees / representative. I need a course of action on how to best resolve this issue so that I can either be compensated for the Ipad, or I get an Ipad back from Asurion that works and is functionally intact. I am starting to think that neither is ever going to occur. It is my hopes and desires that someone with Asurion or AT&T will reach out to me and provide me with a credible and honest solution to this. I still have no Ipad, no compensation for the Ipad and no hope that anyone with Asurion really even cares.

The reason I say that is because I was asked "was there any accessories"  that I had with my phone,  I told him yes and all it was was a screen protector that I paid a good chunk of change for. The gentleman responded back with ok what about earbuds? I told him yes and he said, we will make sure those get in with your device and as far as the screen protector, it comes with a factory one. Well I said awesome that's great I appreciate it thank him for his service and commended him on how polite and respectful he was. I got my phone in the mail and there was no screen protector no we're buds the only thing that was in there that they said would be in there was my phone. If the gentleman wouldn't have said it comes with a factory one or we will make sure it gets in with your device I would give it a higher rating and I wouldn't be as upset.

titre: The process of submitting my claim tookâ€¦
comment: The process of submitting my claim took several times, due to the website that they prefer you to use taking way too long.  It timed out several times were I had to go back several times and re-enter in the info I already inputted.  Everything else was great except the initial submitting the claim.  Replacement phone came next day with easy instructions on how to set up the new phone

titre: Easy claim process and quick turnaroundâ€¦
comment: Easy claim process and quick turnaround on the replacement item.  It was much easier than I thought it would be.

Had to go through the claims process 3 times.The first time it hung, the second time it went through everything then said the phone model was not in service on the line on the time. The third time it went through everything (20 minutes) then demanded I download a form (which I have never had to do), fill it out essentially swearing I was not a liar and make a copy of it and my drivers license, and then scan them and send them to them. They then said I would have an answer in 2 hours, I got it 16 hours later. The overall feel now is that they treat everyone like a liar, try to make the process as slow as possible to discourage you from applying, reject every claim the first time, and are adding more and more difficult steps to the process. Let me add I realize they have probably had a number of fraudulent or problematic claims, but making things harder for people with legitimate claims and making you feel like you are being accused of cheating will slowly erode the business model. 3 years ago I could have processed the same claim in less than 5 minutes. Discouraging fake claims is understandable, but making the process so onerous that long-time customers are cancelling is just dumb.I have had 4 lines covered by Asurions for year, I will be cancelling all 4. As a long time customer my recommendation is do not bother with their coverage, it is not worth what you pay or the hassle of doing a claim.

titre: Decent service, but you can't trust the prices on their web site
comment: We've returned my son's phone once and had the screen fixed once without problems.  We were about to return one of his phones again (yes, he's not very responsible), but when I talked with the Verizon guy he said the deductible was $150 !!!!  The Asurion web site says $29 for screen repair and $89 for replacement.  Nothing (not even a disclaimer in small print) says anything about a deductible other than those two.  When the Verizon guy called them on it, the Asurion rep just reiterated the $150 deductible and made no attempt to honor the price on their web site.  If I were a lawyer, I'd sue for false advertising.  As it is, all we can do is complain on sites like this.

Your experience will vary wildly depending on where you live and what vendors in your area support Asurion. I used the service twice, once in Florida and again in New York. The Florida experience was top-notch with a repairman coming to me to replace a cracked LCD. Unfortunately, a month later I need to do it again only this time in New York. Lo and behold, I was told that the cracked LCD cannot be replaced and that I needed to spend $150 on a replacement phone. Oh, and they didn't have any replacements in stock, I needed to wait on the back order.  No degree of explaining to the rep that I already had the LCD replaced under their plan would make him understand that the information he was giving me was inaccurate. He quickly offered to cancel the claim for me, then I called Verizon and canceled the coverage. I paid less to have the screen replaced at a local repair shop.  I'll never go back.
Would definitely recommend.

titre: a week and a half and still no phone.
comment: It starts a week and a half ago. I submit claim get email saying to wait until claim is approved. Next day I get an email saying to call them. I call and they resubmit my claim because i allegedly reported wrong phone.(i didnt). next day i get an email that my documents were accepted. I click on their link and nothing....another phone call. They said to wait one more day until my claim is approved...wait...what? again?. ok. so i wait get same email with same link and call yet again.... a week and 2 day later im super mad. I said im not hanging up u til you take my payment and give me my phone....no the adjusters department is closed..... sooooo frustrating. turns out they are only open the same time i work. . a week and a half and still no phone so i have to take an hour off work to get this done...and yet they wanted me to wait one more day. any good customer service agent would sympathize and try to make u feel good...a discount a free case...something....no...not them. Their "supervisor" said why should they if im the one that lost my phone. i said lady....its been a week and a half....anyways...im atill screwed cause i have no choice for insurance through my phone service.
Fast. Quick. Took longer to re do new phone...

titre: Iâ€™m not sure where the 5 star reviewsâ€¦
comment: Iâ€™m not sure where the 5 star reviews are coming from but my guess is it is there own employees.  This is the worst company Iâ€™ve ever dealt with. They ask security questions from 25 years ago that only the best of memories would know. I gave them my account # gave them my address gave them my phone number even offered my SS number but they would not accept any of them. After taking to supervisor he said they would only process claim if I sent them affidavit and drivers license. I went down to AT&T they gave me affidavit and took pic of my license and sent it to Asurion. My wife and I have been with AT&T for over 20 years. I am authorized user. They now will not process claim because she is primary account holder!  WTH? Itâ€™s my phone my number that is broke. THEY DO NOT WANT TO PAY!!!!! Finding every reason not to instead of taking care of it simply. DO NOT BUY INSURANCE FROM AT&T itâ€™s not there own coverage it is a cut rate company trying not to process claims. There security questions are unreasonable and designed to help them not pay claims. I wish I didnâ€™t have to give them 1 star. Horrible horrible experience!!!! Stay away your monthly payment for insurance on your phone is only to pad there pockets!!!!!!!!

Having Total Mobile Protection (TMP) is great! The downfall is that is misleading from my phone carrier. Only three lines are covered per year. If it's "Total" then all ten of my lines should be covered and not have to pay for coverage on each additional line. That additional Mobile Protection coverage (MP) should reflect online when trying to file a fourth claim. Next, when a claim is filed under a phone number then that number is changed through phone carrier then that should follow over to Asurion. Same phone but different number. Who remembers previous numbers? Proper documentation should be on record/file so a person doesn't have to keep repeating oneself each time calling in. Also, when sending a replacement phone and person prefers to pick up, please make sure that pick up location isn't miles away. In your next team meeting use my account as a prime example. In approx one month I've had to replace two different phone lines, same phones, five to six times with same issue. Customer service rep (CSR) should make sure transfer is to correct department (warranty) and not bounce a person from place to place. When sending a replacement phone: 1. Why not an indirect signature i.e signing the door tag or something online 2. Have a delivery time window i.e 8a-12p, 12p-4p or 4p-8p and ask the customer what's a good time window 3.Saturday delivery option with time windows 4. Collaborate with the phone carrier.  Some of the replacement phone cost deductibles are ridiculously expensive. Seems like paying TMP or MP  would help defray that cost. Lastly, thanks for the expediant delivery of my phones. Well, with all of the confusion I got not one but two phones for both lines in two days. The additional phones have been sent back. I certainly don't want to be charged for an oversight. ðŸ˜‰

titre: My only issue is the $150.00 charge
comment: My only issue is the $150.00 charge. Pretty expensive considering Iâ€™ve had cell phones for 20+ years and always had insurance at the current rate. This is the first time I have ever used insurance. At a modest $7.99 a month average I have spent well over $2,000 plus this $150 to get a reconditioned phone. Doesnâ€™t quite seem fair. But I guess itâ€™s better than having to pay for a brand new phone as well as all the insurance premiums Iâ€™ve paid... You guys have a racket going and we are at your mercy...

The monthly premiums I paid since I received the phone +the deductible still totalled out to more than sending my broken phone to Google and getting a new phone would have cost.To asurion: if you would like to reach out to me and re-instate my policy I would be happy to edit my review to note that. You have my contact information, I don't feel the need to reach out to you via email so you can send me the same email explanation again. titre: Never AGAIN will I use Asurion
comment: They scheduled a vendor to come out who didnâ€™t show up or call. Took another 2 weeks to get a different vendor set up... each time I had to call in to see the status because they didnâ€™t update me and when I called in the customer service was horrible and unhelpful. They cut me off and weâ€™re short and rude to me when asking questions. Finally got a vendor set to come out and the vendor had to order a part for the washing machine. Assurion said the part was back ordered but it wasnâ€™t. They just lied about remembering to order the part. I verified through this with the invoices I got. So by this time itâ€™s taken 2 months and obviously weâ€™ve had to do laundry at a laundry mat with a family of 4. They told me that I would get reimbursed for all the funds as long as I provide proof... nope found out later that itâ€™s only a certain amount. So here we are 3 months later still washing machine not fixed. If I didnâ€™t assist them in doing their job it probably would take longer! Iâ€™ll never purchase warranties through this company again. Not that they care.

Customer Service and Product ExchangeI don't normally comment on poor service.  However when it is really bad I think I have a responsibility to alert other consumers.I've had Asurion for 30 months.  I have paid all my primiums and costs.  I did bear my phone 13 months ago and they replaced it with a refurbished phone (something I didn't know) and it worked fine.  About 5 months ago it started working slower and slower.  The solution is a replacement battery.  When I took it to the store to replace at my cost, they would not as the phone had been tampered with and had non-authorized parts added to it.I called Asurion about this and they assured me they would replace the tampered with phone.  After serveral hours of paper work and about 5 days they let me know they would not honor sending me a quality product as I had gone over 12 months since I got the phone.  I went to customer services and 2 levels of supervisors who had quite an uncaring viewpoint that they had sent me tampered with product and saw no problem with not having to be responsible for their having originally sent me an altered product.  There is a thing called "Criminal Exchance".  I paid all my dues to Asurion and kept my side of the bargain.  They sent me a tampered with product that I could not even get repaired (unlike my original phone) and they think this is the correct level of exchange and would not honor a quality exchange.I would advise anyone to stay away from them and their service at this stage of the game.

My daughter had an iPhone 6 Plus with a cracked screen. She called Assurion, put in a claim, paid a hefty deductible and received a phone. It worked for about 5 months and will now no longer charge, leaving her with no phone. She took the phone to Apple. Apple said the phone was refurbished with an after market screen  (not Apple), and that these parts caused problems with the phones internal board.  They did document the problem and gave her a copy stating that the problem was caused by the phone repair. . They said they have tons of problems with Assurion refurbished phones and recommended she not get another one. I began calling Asurion  for her today . It took me 5 phone calls and a Verizon rep ( my carrier is (AT&T),  The Assurion associate could not help me, sent me back to AT&T who ordered the wrong phone and can not cancel  it. Also, this would be another refurbished phone. Now we must wait for the wrong phone and send it back. Asurion must make certain that before buying their insurance ALL customers are told that replacement phones are refurbished and that Apple certified parts are not used on Apple products.ThIs needs  to be in bold print on their web site. As a side note, my son had a similar problem, went to Apple and it cost him less and he can maintain his Apple warranty .I have had insurance on our phones through AT&T since 1996.

I was happy to see that Asurion offered repair options for cracked screens. I made my claim, and setup my appointment for repair on 02/14* My screen was damaged on 02/14/18 while I was at work, and after work I learned that someone hit my parked car which made it unable to drive.*I REALLY NEED A FUNCTIONING PHONE NOW*I filed my claim, and was told that a person will arrive the next day 02/15 between 3-5PM. I foolishly set  it  up to have them go to my work to repair the device, but reschedule my appointment to my residence once I realized that I will not have a rental car in time to go to work.*I was able to reschedule for a same day appointment! I was told a repair person will arrive between 5-7PM. No Call, No Show, No FixI called Asuion on 02/16/18 to inquire why no one showed up or called. Through conversation with the Asurion rep I learned that these repair services they offer now are through a 3rd party, so you know (wink, wink) bad 3rd party. Not us, Asurion, but 3rd party.This 3rd party company that Asurion entrust with its customers lied to Asurion about contacting me. Asurion goes off whatever the 3rd party tells them, and they add the info to your account. According to the Asurion rep the 3rd party notified Asurion (not me) that they did not have my replacement part..I was told that the 3rd party claimed to have sent me something stating all of this. Not true.On 02/15 I was busy working with two different car insurances and Asurion for my phone. Asurion is the insurance company that failed me, not the two auto insurance companies. Isn't that something in itself.My conversation today 02/16 was annoying. I only contacted them for my $30 refund. There's no repercussions for the inncovience and even though I pay monthly for Asurion I will have to find an alternative repair on my own. Although, I was offered to purchase a replacement phone from Asurion for $100.WTH. Total B.S. it's a cracked screen! Leave it to my cell phone insurance to attempt to take advantage of me.Fyi Asurion. I would have liked to know before hand that you were not sending an Asurion employee to my home. I actually try to limit these 3rd party contracted people for even coming to my residence.

titre: Cancelled Payments - Waste Of Mine and Your Money
comment: When you hear others talking about scams you never imagine that the employee at The Source (Canada) , a business you thought you could trust, would be trying to sell one to you. However it happens people, and this Insurance company is a huge waste of money. Iâ€™m a Bell Mobility user and I have an iPhone 6s that I bought at full price with no contract In July. I paid 900$ and some for the phone which is now worth around 600$. Now listen to this, and bear with me because it is dicey. With Bell right now you can upgrade to get the same phone I have 6s 32 gb for 129.00, I know what youâ€™re thinking; Thatâ€™s on a contract and Iâ€™m not on a contract. but it doesnâ€™t make a difference if you were already on one or not. Its still 129.00$ to upgrade renewing your contract while Asurion charges you 279.00$ for a Iphone 6s when I pay them 11$ a month. So if I was on a contract Iâ€™d be paying Bell a deductable for the phone, plus Iâ€™d be paying Asurion for Insurance when I could just not pay the insurance company anything save 11$ and renew my contract is anything happened to the phone. So I called the insurance company and the first employee I talked to directed me back to Bell whom directed me back to the Insurance Company whom directed me to some type of supervisor. I told the man my problem and he told me that the benefit of paying 11$ a month is that I donâ€™t have to renew my contract or get on a contract. Then he proceeded to list the price of an Iphone 6s Plus brand new and what it would cost me, Mind you I have an Iphone 6s 32 GB. Technically this is correct that if I wanted to go buy my iPhone brand new it would be cheaper to pay the insurance company the cost.. In my situation however if youâ€™re already on a contract, no way, youâ€™re paying this insurance company 11$ for no reason. Not to mention all the other hidden secrets this company has, that I learned about from the comment sections on their Facebook. Thereâ€™s literally no good reviews. When the employee at The Source sold me on this company for the second time they had told me it was 150$ to replace it if it was lost/stolen or water damaged, and free if you have the phone but itâ€™s just damaged. This is so far from the truth even Iâ€™m laughing, so people before you have to learn from youâ€™re own experience; learn from mine. It cost me about 120$ a year, and a lot more in time. Do your research before naively believing retail employees with these ridiculous warrantees/insurance companies. Because yes with Bell billing issues are just a phone call away from being solved but not with third party companies like Asurion. I told the man I was talking to who was supposed to be a supervisor that I was requesting a refund in my money for the insurance on the 6s since July since I was cancelling it and 100% dissatisfied with the company. Not suprisingly this request was denied with a friendly have a wonderful day, so the lesson is to not trust Employees at companies like the Source as well as I have been over the years. Do your research before you blindly agree to monthly payments for â€œinsuranceâ€ purposes, because sometimes- they offer you no insurance.

titre: First I am doing all the work.
comment: First I am doing all the work. I  was told to send photos of my television to the technician. After the photos was sent an appointment was set. I took off work to be home when the tech arrived. The tech never arrived to the appointment. So I called the tech, and was told to check my email because he was told not to come to the appointment. The tech tells me that Walmart will be sending me an email. I checked my email there was nothing there from walmart. After many phone calls I'm told by the care plan center  that I have a crack in my television.  I tell them there is no crack on the television. The care plan center  tells me the crack is inside of the television not on the outside. How dose a television crack itself on the inside? I may have been more accepting of the statement if my television was in an area accessible by the whole family, however that is not the case. I was told my television will not be fixed and my television will not be replaced.  The process was not professionally done. I am still waiting on something in writing telling me the findings from the tech and an explanation as why my television is not covered. What is the plan for?

titre: Deductible cost is more than repair cost and claim process is ridiculous
comment: We have had Asurion insurance on my daughter's iPhone7 for more than a year at $8.99/mth. She cracked her screen and we went to file a claim. As we tried to complete the process, we learned there is a $169 deductible for a screen replacement repair that is only $150 at Apple and $100 elsewhere. This is a complete and total SCAM from our perspective. NEVER AGAIN! I suspect none of these reviews are making it to the Asurion website nor being factored into their displayed rating.

titre: Asurion is fast and good - except sometimes...
comment: I've used Asurion at least three times.  The first two or three were quick and without problem.  This last time there was more than a week involved in about four or five very time consuming and frustrating attempts, well more than 7 hours of total time - to get Asurion to accept the claim.That wasn't helped by some technical reason I could not get their web site to respond, and they could not suggest a solution.But at least I was finally able to talk to a real person, and we thought the claim was processed: but after a few days, when I checked again, it was still hung up.  Finally, after talking with yet another person, I had to submit more even more documents. After that, I got my replacement phone within two days. My good experiences still outweigh my bad - when things all work as they expect, Asurion is set up to respond quickly and well.  If you expect the unexpected, however, it might take a bit longer....

comment: For a Amazon bought Seiko 5 watch, just short of its first year, after it started acting up, a call to Asurion was an experience in of itself, where the politeness was beyond expectations. But with the response and speed with which I was sent the necessary tools for return, I recognized them to legit. After the usual wait time, it was repaired and shipped overnight (didn't expect this). Unfortunately the watch (Automatic) continued to have the same problem. After a rpt. call & pleasant return, a few weeks later, I received an email where total price paid was refunded to my Amazon acct.This kind of retail business is unexpected in this day & time. Not only do I thank Asurion for this, though unexpected for a recognized watch manufacturer, but also the company Amazon, who holds its partners to such high standards, that I reordered the same watch again from Amazon.I have to applaud this style of business, coming from the past trust I've had of American business, which lately has come under increased scrutiny and criticism

From my experience replacing my stolen phone, it is clear that Asurion is more concerned about being ripped off by their customers than they are about an expedient and easy customer experience.  Every time they had a question about the phone or needed another document, I received an email.  Unfortunately, most of us do most our emailing on our phones nowadays and this caused delays that could have been avoided if they 1) collected payment info and verified shipping address at the time of the claim and 2) used the alternative contact number they requested, rather than email.  The car insurance I carry covers over $60,000 worth of automobiles and offload toys with full coverage for just over $130/month.  If I were in an accident, I am immediately offered a ride, a loaner is part of the claim,  I get a new vehicle that is equal in value and the deductible is $500.  I pay $17/month for iPhone insurance and when I have to make a claim, get treated with suspicion, no loaner is offered, have to wait several days for a new phone to arrive and it is a refurbished phone that is probably worth $400.  The deductible is half the cost of the phone.  Why can't I just upgrade to a new phone and have Asurion and Sprint figure out the return?   I will receive a refurbished phone in the mail tomorrow and then have to go to a sprint store to return it.  What a waste of time and resources!  Bottom line Asurion is more interested in covering their own interests and not the customer's.
Prompt, professional, and easier than what I expected

After one phone call with an Asurion rep who put me on hold after 20 minutes and then sent me to a message saying they could not help me and cut off the call, I then spent two hours on the phone with AT&T and Asurion (who was doubting my coverage that AT&T was confirming I had), Asurion verbally accepted that I had coverage and I filed a claim.  Six days later Asurion sent a letter saying it denied the claim because I had no coverage.  I had already decided to cancel the coverage because after saying they would cover a screen replacement, they changed their mind saying they were sending a replacement phone - which was fine until I found out they were replacing my less than a week old phone with a "refurbished" one.  I sent back the refurbished phone and went to CPR here in town.  In one hour they replaced my screen on my new phone for $75 less than the insurance deductible.  I am glad others are having good experiences but I cannot believe I am the only one who has had a terrible experience.

I have had the absolute worst experience with this company. First off, I have been trying to get my phone for over half a month now. My phone was stolen along with my debit card, insurance card and ID and Asurion wanted me to send in a picture of my photo ID (which obviously I could not). I was able to find an old expired ID which, although expired, contained my correct full name and DL number. I paired this with my SS card in hopes that it would give credit to my expired ID. Of course, Asurion declined these documents. I spoke on the phone with a lady and told her my current ID was stolen along with my phone and this was the best I had until I got my ID in the mail and she told me to resend the same documents and that she would put a note in my file. I did, and of course had to wait another 24 hours before I heard back (for the second time). I finally got an email and called to once again be told that my documents were declined due to them being expired. I informed this second lady that I had already spoken to someone about the issue and that she was supposed to have put a note in my file and had told me to resend the same documents. The second lady put me on hold and transferred me to another more directly related lady who I had to explain everything to for the 3rd time. She asked if I could send in a paper copy which I could not because I ordered it online. I told her I might be able to find an email and she said if it contained the correct information they needed (which she did not inform me of what this information was exactly, obviously not my DL number) then they would accept it. She then also claimed to have put a note in my file. I checked my email and it didn't have any personal information on it whatsoever so I knew it wouldn't do any good and these people wouldn't accept anything less than a current valid photo ID which I would have to wait until I got. I finally received my ID and got my claim accepted to be able to order another phone. When I went to input all of the payment and shipping information, I had to change the address my phone was being sent to because they had auto-filled the blank with an old address they had on file. Because of this, once I hit complete I once AGAIN got a notice that my claim was under review and to check back in 24 hours. At this point I am extremely annoyed as I had already been waiting so long simply to be able to have my phone on its way to me. The next day, I got an email that said I can move on to the next step of the claim, however, when I went to the website my old address was once again auto-filled in the blank. I didn't want a repeat of what happened last time so I called sprint directly and had my address changed and had it processed immediately so that I could have my phone sent to my current address. I then went back on the Asurion website once more and completed the process yet again. Checking back later, the website assured me that my phone was on its way and would be there the next day. This was perfect timing because I made sure my package had to be signed for and I was home for that day. The next day I went to check the shipping status only to find that Asurion had taken me back to the payment page as if nothing ever happened. Confused, I called and talked to a lady who told me it was because my phone was on back order but that they were getting a shipment of it that day and I'd have my phone by tomorrow. I asked her what happened to the $250 I spent on my deductible and she said it was just to reserve the phone for me. To which I asked if I'd have to shell out another $250, because if so I might as well just get another brand new phone instead of going around in circles with these people for over half a month. She said no I wouldn't have to pay again, it would just be the next day when I received my phone. I called later and spoke to a man that said I would have to go back and complete the information and payment process all over again, contrary to what the lady told me. At this point I'm furious from all the waiting and misinformation. I went back and completed the process again once I made sure I wasn't charged for the $250 the first time. Once completed I finally received an email saying my phone would be there the NEXT day. I took off of work so I could made sure I was here to sign for my phone. Today, I went to fed ex to track my package and I see that the city it shows that it's being delivered to is different from the city I have on file and entered when I filled everything out to have my phone sent to me. Completely done at this point, I called for the millionth time and spoke to a lady who said they made a mistake on their end (go figure) and it was too late to change the address now because it was already on transit and I'd have to wait yet another day. I informed her that I had my package require a signature and that I had taken off of work so I'd be able to sign for it and that I couldn't take off of work the next day. Because of this, I now have the package supposedly coming to my workplace tomorrow. I have zero hopes that everything will go as planned because time and time again this company has royally F'ed everything up. I STILL don't have a phone, and I'm just hoping my phone isn't stolen from the house they are delivering it to because THEY apparently don't know how type in a simple address correctly. If I had a choice over which insurance company to go through for my phone, it wouldn't be this one. Worst experience ever, and all they can offer is a "sorry".

I've made use of Asurion twice. The first time, I chose reimbursement, and received an e-gift card within 24 hours of returning my broken phone. I was very pleased, and recommended this protection plan to many people. Unfortunately, last week, I chose replacement, and Asurion didn't take any action to replace my phone until FIVE DAYS after I mailed it off. The representative I spoke with had no record of my new phone being sent out. After he made a note, it took THREE DAYS for Asurion to adjust my claim status to where I'll be issued an e-gift card within the next two days. As it stands, I'll be without a phone for 9 to 10 days. I wish there was a way to mitigate my losses, and keep recommending Asurion, but, for now, I can't.

titre: Worst customer service experience I have had in years!!!!!
comment: First let me say that we have had phone through Verizon for 23 years and have used Asurion and PAID Asurion for as long as they have been affiliated with Verizon.I had the most horrendous experience with Asurion today that I have had with any company in years!   I had a confirmed appointment today for repair of a cracked screen.  It took 5 days to get this repair scheduled. It was confirmed by text and email.  I left work early to be at home during the repair window.  Sat for 2 hours waiting for my appointment time to come and go.  At the end of the two hours I called the number provided on my email appointment confirmation.  Customer service representative #1 tried to schedule a repair appointment for me not realizing I had been sitting and waiting for two hours.  #2 Supervisor claimed that the tech did not have the "part" and had left a message for me at 3:05 pm to reschedule.  There is no message or missed call on any of our family's four phones.  The only thing they could do is send a new phone for $149 or schedule a repair again a week out. #3 Floor Supervisor could do nothing other than make the same offer of a new phone for $149 or a new appointment a week out.  #4 Corporate Office employee Marilyn Gualty in Customer Services (would not give me her title) now claims a tech called us a 9:15 am.  No technician called at any time today.  She claimed she could do nothing else other than offer me a $25 gift card, a $149 phone or another week of waiting.  Not one of the four customer service reps could tell us the name of the tech, the phone number they supposedly called, the phone number to call back the tech.   This was a complete waste of my time, now taking from when I left my office at 4:45 pm until I hung up the phone with customer services at 8 pm.  The last representative asked If I would like to take the survey on my experience to which I gladly replied YES!  To add insult to injury the survey was malfunctioning and whether I said the rating number or entered my rating number on my phone, the survey asked my the same questions  over and over again in a loop!  Not even the feedback survey provided good customer service.If Asurion is a customer service company, then they have failed.  If no customer service person has the power or authority to fix the problem then there is a significant problem with this company.  If Asurion uses contract techs that cannot  be trusted to show up and that lie about leaving a message, then they can't guarantee their customer service.   We have paid for Asurion insurance for multiple phones for over 6 years and only made one claim other than this one.  We will be dropping Asurion for Apple Care and believe me we will tell everyone we know thanks to social media.  We have also called Verizon customer service to register our complaint referencing our claim number.

titre: This company donâ€™t care our situations!
comment: If you will not care my situations why you guys take money for insurance! I paid all payment of my Apple iPhone 8plus and I finished my payment and insurance with this phone then I had an Samsung note8 Black from Verizon and I covered it by Asurion insurance. titre: Very impressed with the service I â€¦
comment: Very impressed with the service I received.  Couldnâ€™t have asked for more courteous prompt attention.
Fast process! Great service.

Terrible customer service!I began filing a claim for my damaged phone on 11/24/17.  I began my claim at a Verizon store, and was told to complete my claim online at home. Even though I had an email from Asurion stating that I needed to complete my claim, their website would not allow me to do so, and kept telling me I needed to call customer service. I had to wait until a neighbor got home to call from their phone to file my claim.  This call ended up being ~1 hour due to the customer service representative being very unhelpful (stated he could  not ship my replacement phone to my address unless there was someone to sign for it). I offered alternatives (shipping the device to the Verizon store , shipping the device to my place of employment), but he continued stating that it could only be shipped to my home address and someone must be present to sign for the package.  After requesting to speak to a manager repeatedly, he finally agreed to have it shipped to my work address, but stated there would be a hold on the claim until the following day, but that the phone would still be received on Monday as long as I submitted my deductible payment upon receiving the email.  Prior to asking for a manager, the representative even suggested taking off work in order to wait for my device to arrive at home on Monday (thankful I didn't do that as now the phone isn't being delivered until Tueday). I received an email Saturday am, stating that my claim was approved, and paid my $149 deductible.  I waited until 3:00 on Monday for my phone to be delivered and then tracked the package.  UPS stated the package delivery date was being rescheduled for Tuesday, 11/28.  I called Asurion customer service to attempt to resolve this issue, as the device was supposed to have been delivered today, Monday, 11/27. After speaking to 4 agents total (the 1st told me there was no manager only a Care Solutions team), and the last two were evidently managers (even though I was told there were no managers), my issue is still not resolved. They stated they were unable to work with UPS to get my package delivered (or available for pick today), although UPS states the package is in my city, and that they "do not compensate" for anything because they are an insurance company.  After being on the phone for over an hour with Asurion today, I have no phone (hopefully it will actually be delivered tomorrow), and they would not refund any of my deductible. They offered to send me a gift card (1st $20, then $25, and finally $30).  Both managers also stated that the information the initial customer service with Asurion gave me (on Friday evening) was incorrect, and that the package could have been delivered to my home address with no signature required (and this would have resulted in the claim being completed Friday evening and my package would have been here today). Asurion's customer service is terrible, and I will be cancelling with them as soon as my replacement device is received.  They do not take accountability for their mistakes, and continuously state "we do not compensate, as we are an insurance company."  I do not recommend this company at all, and will no longer be using them.

titre: Verizon and Asurion A Winning Combinaiton
comment: The Verizon tech took care of the claim without any trouble.  The phone arrived 24 hours sooner than I thought it would.  I took the box to the Verizon tech and they transferred all my phone numbers, texts and photos.  Nothing was lost in the process.

Absolutely terrible service. Dishonest and dishonourable. Asurion refused to replace my iphone when it was stolen. First they denied the claim by making up a new bogus rule, which wasn't in the terms and conditions of the phone protection plan insurance contract.  They said I needed to have used "airtime" on the day of the loss, which of course is not a requirement of the contract. When I pointed that out to them, they then said they were going to deny the claim because people were still calling the number after it was stolen. I pointed out that all I can do is have the service provider block the phone and SIM card from being used for outgoing calls and texts and for data use (which I did), but I can't stop incoming calls from people who don't know the phone has been stolen. There is nothing I can do about that. My service provider verified for Asurion that my phone was stolen and that it had been blocked and blacklisted so that no-one could use it on any network and that the only activity now is attempted (incompleted) incoming calls. My service provider also asked Asurion to honour the contract and replace my phone, but Asurion still refused.  Asurion also refused to put the denial of the claim or the reasons for the denial in writing. They also told me there was no appeal or dispute resolution process and that the decision was final and that there was nothing I could do about it. They clearly had no intention of honouring the contract and were making up bogus excuses to try to justify denying the claim.

titre: Fast and easy thanks for getting me my â€¦
comment: Fast and easy thanks for getting me my new phone so fast.

Everything was pretty much fine. It went better over the phone than I expected and the phone arrived super fast--which I really needed. The only thing that went wrong was that when I was asked about any lost accessories I mentioned that my hard shell case and my screen protector were gone with the phone and they sent a soft wallet style cover for my phone. Not a real big deal, but the case was basically just garbage for me. Other than that pretty good experience. Glad I had the insurance.

I NEVER write reviews on anything, but am so outraged with the hours I have spent on the phone with Asurion, getting nowhere, I have to warn others. The end of October one of our iphones was closed in a door and glass was cracked with glass pieces coming out everywhere. Much to my surprise it still could text and take calls, so it went in a zip lock and we continued to use it. Immediately, I called Asurion to place a claim and was told it was on "back order" so it would take 7-10 days to get a new phone. On day 10, the phone still hadn't arrived. Placed call and was told it was still on back order and they would cut me a check, minus my $250 deductible. I agreed on the check at this point and waited and waited for the check to come. It finally arrived 18 days after I placed my claim! They had also told me they would provide a receipt after my check was processed showing my deductible because my screen protection company will reimburse me part of my deductible. (On this phone call, they told me they would email me a reciept if I called once receiving the check.) After hours of being on the phone with them (and on hold for "1-2 minutes" repeatedly), transferred from person to person, who each tell me a different story, I am told that they cannot send me a receipt, I need to wait until it shows up on my AT&T bill, which will show in 1-2 billing cycles. Well, the screen protection insurance company, who is very efficient, had sent me a new screen protector in 2 days after a 5 minute phone call, but would need the receipt within 60 days to issue a refund on the deductible. The Asurion representatives I spoke with really didn't seem to care. So I took the check, went to Apple to purchase a new iPhone and purchased the Apple Care along with it, which I should have done from day 1! Apple Care is actually much cheaper, their deductables are less expensive and their customer service is phenomenal.  If I had Apple Care from the start, I would have had my new phone the day it broke and the receipt to go along with it, with an extra $100 in my pocket. Lesson learned.

titre: I am in the military and had just â€¦
comment: I am in the military and had just gotten back from overseas. My wife and I purchased new phones on my family's plan and the had to move to a new duty station. Right before we left my wife's phone went in some water and of it died. We tried to file the claim before we had to move but it was denied because Asurion could not see it on our bills since it was so new. So we ran out of time and had to move. Well we finally got settled in to our new home. Unpacking and organizing a home take time. I finally found everything I needed to resubmit the claim. Now they tell me that I took to long and will not accept the claim. They don't care about the reason why I had to wait. They certainly don't care about the customer. The transcript is belowInfo: Thank you for choosing to chat with us. An agent will be with you shortly.Info: You are now chatting with Korsica.Korsica:Hello, how may I assist you today?You: I would like to resubmit my claim *****Korsica:I will be happy to assist you, Katherine.You: The first time you guys said the phone was not in use because I had just gotten itKorsica:I do apologize, based on the information you have provided, I will not be able to approve your claim. You did not report your claim in a timely manner as required in the Coverage Certificate.You: I reported it a week after it happenedYou: But you said that there was no usageKorsica:I do apologize, the claim has been cancelled. You may resubmit with the correct information.Korsica:Is there anything else I can assist you with today?You: I tried to resubmit but then you say it took to longKorsica:I just cancelled the claim.Korsica:Do you have any further questions that I may assist you with today?You: What do you mean you cancel Ed the claimYou: How does that help meKorsica:The claim was denied due to time frame, so I cancelled it that way you can proceed with the correct information.You: Ok the damage happened right before I moved.You: I did not have time to file or an address to send it too at that timeYou: The loss occurred in AugYou: Your system just auto denies itKorsica:You will need to re file the claim on phoneclaim.com.You: But I just did and it denied itYou: *****Korsica:I'm sorry, we won't be able to replace the device if the claim is denied.Korsica:I'm sorry for the inconvenience; however, the insurance policy states that a claim must be filed within 90 days of the loss. We won't be able approve your claim.You: There is no recourse?Korsica:No, I'm sorry, there is not.

So basically you pay 60 for the warranty and another 40 to use the warranty to be left with no product, a hassle to get what money is left, and having to buy another one on your own. Pointless.

titre: Difficult initially but in the end it worked out
comment: Update: Changing review to 3 stars from 1 star. Shortly after writing this I was actually able to chat with the first representative who was able to get me a tracking label immediately and stayed on line with me to confirm receipt. The processing of the warranty claim was great after the initial issues. So, although I had issues initially, once I was actually able to get a return label I was happy with the experience. Initial Review: I have been trying for over a month to get a return label for a claim submitted on a product I purchased. The site status says my return shipping label is on its way for over a month now. I have had 3 chat sessions now with support and each time they say I will have a label emailed within 2 hours. I never get it. They state my email provider may be blocking or sending to spam but I have tried multiple providers with the same result (Yahoo and Gmail). Plus I am receiving the chat transcripts just fine from the asurion.com domain and if those aren't blocked, the label would not be either. There is no way that I can find to contact them by phone, it is always via chat, and the response is always the same. To be honest I think they make people jump through as many hoops as possible to get them to give up and have no intention of actually honoring the warranty they sold. At this point I am left with few options other than filing a BBB complaint, a complaint to my state Attorney General and to Amazon where I purchased the warranty. Although I think Amazon stopped using them as the warranties now appear to be offered through Square Trade and I can see why.

titre: Asurion did an excellent job with â€¦

Asurion is THE WORST company on the planet. Given that they have a monopoly on cell insurance, customers are forced to deal with their awful customer service, confusing policies, and frustrating phone trees. I called Asurion on 10/29 to file a claim for my son's defective phone. When he still had not received it by 11/3, I called back. After several transfers, I was told that the phone was on backorder for 7-10 days. Each person that I was transferred to seemed to be more concerned with proving that I was already told this than handling my concern. When I finally spoke with Julie, the "manager", she again reiterated (like that was necessary) that the phone was on backorder and I should have gotten an email. At this point I'm at the height of my anger, and Julie offers to mail me a check for the retail value of the phone so that I can go to the store to purchase a new one. The check takes 8 days to arrive and they subtract their $225 deductible from that amount. At this point I ask her if this makes sense to her. My concern is that my son is away at college with no phone access. Her resolution is to cancel the order for the phone that's on its way so that we can wait another 8-10 days for a check that DOES NOT cover the price of a phone once they take out their fees. This company is a joke. It's consistently poor ratings from actual customers never appear on their site. My advice to anyone needing cell insurance is to explore other options. ANY OTHER OPTION!!!!

titre: Asurion Gives you a refurb with a warranty for when it breaks AGAIN!
comment: My phone had a software issue so I filed a claim. They sent me a refurbished phone that has a scratch across the back. I called to complain because I expected them to send me a new phone but apparently they just "certified refurbish" all the malfunctioning phones and reship them out. They add a 1 year warranty on the phone they send you because they expect it to have problems (again) and will send you another refurbished phone with a 1 year warranty for when it breaks again. They make so much money off of your monthly insurance payment and then give you crappy phones back. BEST PART is they don't offer a platform for social or online reviews. They give you a PO Box to mail your review in to. If they aren't progressive enough to have online reviews they probably aren't progressive enough to have certified refurbished staff handling all phone repairs.

titre: Dealing with Asurion is worse than dealing with AT&T and that says alot!!!
comment: Tis has been the worst experience other than dealing with AT&T.  First, calling in is a nightmare because of all the trash you have to listen to before you can even begin to make a selection in their, "who do you NOT want to talk to voice command system.  It never gives you the opportunity to talk to a real person.  Finally, after pressing this number than that number, I finally just pressed a bunch of zeros and finally got a person.  Start a claim and am sent an email to fill out the affidavit.Of course, it couldn't be simple where I can just download a pdf.  No, I have to enter the phone number, name and zip code only to be told the information is incorrect. The information is correct.  I notice there is a chat option.  So I click on it only to get a message that chat is closed and to try again between working hours of 9:00 am and 10:00 pm.  Considering it was only 4:00 pm why was I getting this message.Back to the phone........ugh!!!  They can't email me the form, they can only fax it.  So I give them the fax number to my office.  Drive 10 miles to the office only to get a 5 page fax with the statement, "fax file missing.All this so I can pay a $10.00 deductible to replace a damaged $39.00 phone.Let's see if this review shows up on their webpage.  I'm sure it won't.
