titre: I would recommend that nobody use this â€¦
comment: I would recommend that nobody use this company's insurance offering. I insured my mobile phone with Asurion through my carrier, Rogers Communications. I wasn't informed at the time of a deductible, nor was I informed that the 'replacement' phones would be used devices (though they were in the pages and pages of fine print of my contract). After almost two years of my phone working perfectly, I dropped it in water and required a replacement. The following is a brief synopsis of what happened. -Asurion charged me $200 to replace my phone. -The first phone had a battery life of only a couple hours-I asked for a replacement phone-The phone was glitchy and deleted all of my contacts over a period of a couple days-I asked for a replacement phone-The phone had a battery life as bad as the first phone-I'd had  enough and bought a new phone-Asurion offered to give me my money back (and nothing more, which means I paid for mobile phone replacement and got nothing in the end)-Asurion still hasn't refunded me my money over two months later (though they say that the will still do so). In the end, I paid fifteen bucks a month, or ($300) to Asurion and when I needed them the most, I also gave them a repairable phone and $200. What did I get in return? Nothing...as for the $200? I'm waiting with bated breath. This company is a total ripoff. Avoid them at all costs.

titre: Very quick response but had issues with â€¦
comment: Very quick response but had issues with replacement. Had just as quick of a response for the replacement and no issues at all with this one.

titre: Had two very good back to back â€¦
comment: Had two very good back to back experiences. Great, easy to file a claim.  Online & via phone.  Everything was fantastic

I have used this insurance on two occasions within a years time. Both times I attempted to file the claim online and both times the claim hung up just as I was checking out while entering my shipping address. All the address fields received a green check mark except for the city and country. No matter how hard I tried to get the city (Bonita Springs) and country (USA) to be accepted, it would not be accepted! This happened for both of my claims. Each time I opened a chat with a customer service person who said they would fix it for me. They did not not fix the problem, allowed the session to timeout and left me with a message requiring me to produce affidavits, a photo ID, etc., to be faxed to them in order to complete my claim.  The first time I had to struggle through three or four customer service representatives that had no idea what I was talking about when I said that it was their system that was causing the problem and should not be my problem to have to solve, before I finally spoke to a supervisor that agreed with me and handled the problem professionally and sent me a replacement phone overnight. The second incident almost caused me to become apoplectic!!! Before losing my temper I went directly to a Corporate Verizon store and explained the situation to the store manager and showed him a screen shot of the final message from Asurion that appeared when I was checking out when the customer service representative said they would take care of it. The Verizon Manager intervened and called Asurion directly to resolve the problem and gave me a new phone right then and there.  The first time I encountered the problem with Asurion's online submission service, I figured it was a just a glitch and discussed it with the supervisor. She assured me that they would look into and get it fixed and agreed that there was no reason why the address field should not work properly.  But, when it occurred the second time months later, I can only suspect that it is an intentional, built-in, system error meant to add a level of difficulty to the process for users to frustrate us to the point where we just give up and forgo using the insurance all together.  Believe me, when you get on the phone with their customer service representatives and start discussing why you should not need to fill out an affidavit, etc., you will think you were talking to an animatronic doll preprogrammed with one message!!!

Because of this, I couldn't download my old music to the phone for 45 days (you cannot associate two IDs with one phone for a 90 day period). Now that I've waited the 45 days, I have my music, and everything is great. It was just annoying to have to do that when Asurion should have known about the 90 day wait period. This company is ridiculous. I broke my screen, went to the Verizon Store and they said to call this company to setup a claim. I filed a claim and had to pay a $50 deductable. I found out that day, that it was actually cheaper to get a new phone, so I did that. I called Asurion about an hour after the initial call and cancelled my appointment to have my phone screen repaired 2 days later. They said they would credit my $50 back to my account. 2 days later, an asurion repairman showed up to fix my phone and I explained I cancelled that appointment, so he left. 10 days later I called because I hadn't receive the money back. They said it would take 7-10 business day. I explained that the day was currently 7 business days from the initial claim. She said to check back after 10 business days. 4 days later (2 weeks after I cancelled my appointment) I stilled hadn't received the money. I called to ask about it and they said that both the initial rep I talked to and the one I talked to after 7 business days never cancelled the appointment and it was still open. The gentleman then explain that he finally properly cancelled the appointment and it unfortunately reset the clock on my refund and it would be another 7-10 business days. When I said that was unacceptable, they said they expedited it to 3-5 business days, which means it would be a total of at least 19 days to get my $50 back. This is ridiculous. Asurion is more than happy to quickly take your money, but you will have to fight like hell if you expect to get it back. Horrible customer service at a company where it seems that no one know what they're doing. I will never use this company again and am considering dropping Verizon if they continue to use Asurion.

On the second contact, and maybe explaining phone problem better, Asurion took my info and sent a refurbished phone matching mine next day. titre: Quick & easy, but automated system could use some revamping.
comment: The process was pretty simple. The most challenging part was actually getting through the initial claim submission part. The screen on my phone was completely shattered, but i was able to use it with my car to make calls and listen to notifications, and I don't have a working computer to submit online. The main issue was that i was either asked to type or say information and when neither worked, i would get hung up on rather than be transferred to a person who could help me. I had to go to my verizon store and have them help me complete the initial claim, but after that everything went very smoothly. Claim was a little cheaper than expected, and I got my product quickly. Also liked that I got a tracking number for the return, so I could make sure my damaged phone reached the destination (considering the steep charges for either not returning on time or at all). Even with the problems I encountered, I'd still recommend.

comment: In one and a half hours I talked to 6 different reps.  I was hung up on twice and erroneously redirected to AT&T once. When I asked if I purchased a new device and purchased a new policy to cover the new device I was once again redirected to AT&T.  AT&T could not answer that question because it is an Asurion who cancelled my original policy, and Asurion would not say anything other than that the policy is not based on the device but the telephone number associated with the policy.  By the end of this experience I was extremely frustrated and still phoneless with no answer to my question.

titre: after paying my $150 deductible I wish I would have just upgraded
comment: after paying my $150 deductible I wish I had never made my insurance claim on my phone and just upgraded to a new one like I ended up doing plus losing $150. So the phone I sent back I received the refurbish phone  the next day.  Activated it  restored it with all my contacts and emails from work. (Back story)I run a business and I have to transfer my phone to my personal phone multiple times during the day and at the close of each day so a working phone that I pay a lot of money for every month is extremely important. Well no more than 3 days later the phone would no longer respond. I had issues with it from day one but I didn't lose access to it till day 3. I couldn't  open the home screen, type my password in, nothing..the touch screen was  unresponsive . they called it touch  disease. Well I called again to make a second claim and get another phone. Well the lady I was speaking to wouldn't send me a another phone because I couldn't get into my settings in my phone to manually reset the phone. So she told me I would have to call back and they would  "monitor it" take notes in the system. I would have to call back tomorrow.  I've had this phone for less than 4 days and it doesn't work.... pretty upset at this point can't answer business calls or anything. I call back the next day.... the lady I was speaking with told me the only way I could make a second claim is if the trouble shoot it and found problems. So I told her trouble shoot it! Here's the kicker she told me I would have to  manually do this by going to my settings. Again I told the lady I HAVE NO ACCESS TO MY PHONE I CANT GET TO SETTINGS. IT HAS TOUCH DISEASE. Then she proceeds with an  attitude and ask me to hold the power button and lock button down so it will do a reset. So again after it resets I tell her for the 100th time I still can't access my phone. The touch screen is  unresponsive. then she  proceeds to tell me she'll send me a new phone but if the phone comes back "working" there will be a lawsuit against me for a faulty claim. I know you have polices and you have to run a business as well but I think after the 2 second day of calling you would have kinder words to say to someone. So finally I get another  refurbished phone. Well they good news is i didn't even have to back this phone up with all my personal data cause it wouldn't even connect to service. I spent over 2 hours trying to access service before I finally when up to Verizon and after they  fidgeted with it  for over an 1hr they told me there was something wrong with the phone to do an  Insurance claim on it. YOU HAVE TO BE KIDIDING ME. So Verizon kindly let me use there phone to call   asurion since mine didn't work again. They same issues again they didn't bevelie the phone they sent me wasn't working they ask me if I had taken it to my provider so they could try and make it work. I again  explaining to her that I had done all these things I even let her talk to the man at Verizon who was helping me and she told me they would send out a another phone but I wouldnt  receive the phone for four days because of  memorial day weekend. I wouldn't get the phone till Tuesday's. ( memorial day was on Monday) now they were nice enough to up  Grade me to a  BRAND new version ( rather than refurbished) then mine was originally but not the newest model available. I told her I couldn't wait that long I run a buiness i need a phone at least by tomorrow. I been without a working phone for almost a week now an now your telling me it will be another 4 days? there is much more I could say but this has already went on for to long. I ended up just upgrading to a new phone so i could have a Working phone in the end. I'm not rating them bad because things do happen and you always can't help it but I feel they could have prevent a lot of this and maybe done a little more in the end to get me a  temporary phone through Verizon...so Waiting 4 days for a phone wouldnt be so bad.

I took it to my Verizon store & they confirmed my suspicions that it was a repaired tablet from someone else. I will be reading  & the screen will suddenly turn black. I will be looking something up on internet & it will jump to something completely different. At times I have to really jab it to get it to respond. No where near as easy to operate as the one I sent to them.

When we upgrade to new devices we will be exploring other insurance options that have a more streamlined claim process.

Hello,This is the 2nd time filing a claim in 1 year for a faulty phone which is fine, I get that technology breaks. But both times I filed I have to contact 2-3 times to get it right. This time I contacted Monday they said they would be sending me a phone and it would not be a problem. Great! I have been checking my emails and nothing has came so I called them and a claim has not been started and I have to wait another 2 to 3 days to receive the phone, if it happens.The first time it happened I had to contact them three times, maybe more it was a year ago. The first they said they would be sending me a Phone immediately , I got an empty box to send back my phone to get looked at and refurbished then they'd send it back to me so I was would be left without a phone for two weeks or so. Then I contacted and they said they would be sending me a phone but they ended up charging me the entire price for a brand new phone. Had to contact again finally to get a Supervisor who was great and got it covered but it should not take more than once each time to get it right. I understand mistakes happen but it's happened to me five times already, and did nothing for an apology as I should of had the new phone by now and there is not a way to expedite they said.No sincerity, I get it can be hard talking to customers all day but they need to remember that this is our situatuation too and it's frustrating especially when I have to keep contacting.I wish there were another insurance company I could use if I ever have to do this again.

titre: I have never had to make an insurance â€¦
comment: I have never had to make an insurance claim before so I was a little nervous about the process. However, the form took less than 3 minutes to fill out and my phone DID come the next day. I was even able to mail my old phone back via USPS by dropping it off at the nearest mailbox. Since Asurion sent me a prepaid return envelope the process was no hassle. I almost didn't make the claim but I am glad I did.      As for the return service, my old phone was easy to track. I followed the updates up until it made it to its destination. Thanks for insurance. Although it was only a 180 dollar phone I only had to pay 50 dollars for a replacement and even got an upgraded version because the older version was no longer available.      The craziest part about it is that I didn't have to speak to anyone to claim the insurance. It was that easy. I highly recommend this company.

After a couple of minutes on the phone I was offered a newer model with more memory for the inconvenience ( i had an iphone 6 plus). After all this refurbished phones I received I wasn't so hopeful of the phone coming my way. It was a nice surprise to actually receive a brand new 6 S plus. I got to say that even thou my experience wasn't the smothest it wasn't the worst either. Then another time we had a cracked screen and then the phone malfunctioned as well.  The replaced the phone completely.  Both of the rebuilt phones looked and performed like they were brand new.  Apple is really the only problem.  Their process for turning off the "find your phone feature" is a joke.  How might you do this if your phone is malfunctioning?  Well, it's a several day process, which seems crazy and way over the top on what it should be to do.  All in all, Asurion is a great company and offer a great product. I call customer service at Asurion to see if I needed to change a setting or something.  The. Representative said I would have a Brand new phone the next day.  I argued and told her I  thought it had to just be something simple.  Nope I had a new in the box phone The next day. Now who does that?  Most people you deal with now would just give you the run around until you quit bothering them. I have always been sceptical of cell phone insurance,  no longer.  Thanks to all the people that helped me I wish I had kept track of your names so I could thank you properly.

titre: Cracked my screen, had it replaced within 18 hours
comment: Somehow I cracked my screen in a Home Depot parking lot. I wasn't too worried until I ran my thumb against my edge (Galaxy S7 Edge) and almost sliced my thumb. Realized I needed a new phone, asap. Went home, filled out the online forms, signed the paperwork, sent it all in, paid the fee and by 3 the next day, I had a phone in my front porch. Other than an issue with a bad Sim card, I had it up and running by the end of the evening and now have a perfectly working phone. It was even an updated version of my old one.Couldn't be happier. So worth the monthly fee and the co-pay. Will never go without insurance, it's actually not worth it, financially, to risk something happening to my phone.

titre: Phone replace didn't work,  sent new one.

Finally I got a great representative who said to send my replacement back and they send me a new one and because they didn't have my brand and stock I got an upgraded phone and that was great. Overall it was a decent experience.

So, I have a galaxy s6 with Otterbox. Phone gets dropped & screen broken, so I file a claim & pay the deductible to get a refurbished one. Except the $150, was hassle-free. Replacement (in otterbox) dropped a few months later...exact same outcome. When filing second claim, I have to jump through a few more hoops, but I get it...FRAUD! So I pay another $150 (total of $300 now plus monthly insurance plan) and was happily surprised when the replacement came it was a NEW phone not refurbished. Did a little happy dance, until the letter came the next day basically saying, "we've done all we can with you, you now have no insurance"....of course they're not charging me and I did get A NEW replacement,  but dang to drop a loyal customer that way that doesn't have a history of phone accidents. Other than that, extremely satisfied.

titre: Believe first phone was a lemon/second might be too
comment: Son dropped his phone.  Obviously broken.  Would cycle on and off and would do nothing else.  Put in the claim, paid the $149, told the phone would be at house the next day, two extra days later it showed up.  I don't believe that we had the phone for 30 days before it started to cycle through the on/off all the time.  Son took to the local store and they could not figure out what was wrong.  I believe this phone is a lemon.  Company agreed to send a new phone out to arrive the next day (which it did).  Son says that the screen is too sensitive when he types (lots of doubles) he took it to the store and they said there was nothing that could be done about it.    I will not be spending another $149 on a phone again.  Trakphone here they come.
Called and got a phone the next day with no issues both times.

Basically good service but would recommend taking another look at the claim filing process for the consumer.  Presently it is not altogether user-friendly or intuitive.Also, limitation of two claims per year should be re-evaluated.  Sometimes there might be extenuating circumstances surrounding a second claim that could allow for an exception to the two claims per year limitation.In my case, the second claim was the result of a mishap that occurred in the midst of a personal health crisis.  It would be nice if one could have a case reviewed through personal, live contact between the claimant and Asurion to see if an exception might be warranted, a sort of appeal process.Because of the two claim limit, my smartphone now is not covered and will not be until March 2017.  A dissatisfying situation.Thank you for listening.

titre: Quick and fairly painless - only one glitch.
comment: Submitted claim online, paid deductible, new phone arrived at our doorstep following day.  Had difficulty getting Verizon to transfer data from old phone to new phone; hence, it took some extra time to return old phone in postage-paid mailer that came with new phone.  Only issue was I received an email alert saying my iPhone hadn't had the "find my Iphone" feature deactivated and threatened me with a fine of up to $500.  Called Asurion, they said the phone was fine and that those emails are "automatically generated by computer".  What???  Why in God's name would Asurion send such an email if it weren't true?  That was definitely not cool, not at all.  Nevertheless, experience was positive.

titre: Ease of use and minimum of red tape.
comment: Whenever I purchase insurance of any kind, I realize the array of providers starts at the bottom and rises to the top where a select few companies provide stellar service at reasonable rates. My research and due diligence over the years has saved me thousands (if not much more) of dollars and saved me  exasperation, frustration, angst, etc. My recent several claims  with Assurion regarding lost and stolen phones lead me to believe Assurion is in such company. Most notable is their efficiency, their equity, and their respect for my time while providing reliable and competent service. I do highly recommend based on my experiences thus far.

Called Asurion 3 times to finally get my issue resolved.  First 2 times no one was willing to help and it was going to be a week before my phone replacement would be available.  Finally after my boyfriend called on my behalf and talked with a manager they were able to get me a new phone and an upgraded phone S7, delivered to me within 5 business days for the same price as my current replacement an S5.  He also emailed a letter to the customer service department about what an inconvenience this whole process was to finally get a resolution 3rd time around.  A Manager called us the following day after reading the email and sent us a $50 gift card for our inconvience.  Did not start off with good customer service but by the end I guess it all worked out.
Sure the deductible was a lot, but much better than the new phone price, especially when it was an accident and not irresponsible.Thanks for making it so easy:)

Phone was received when promised,  and service was wonderful, my phone starting working again after the replacement one came and just knowing I could send the replacement one back without problems was nice, I ended up keeping it because I thought the battery was acting up, I'm glad I kept the replacement because my phone got really wet and you never know if it will mess up down the road, it's nice to know you can replace a damaged phone without playing full price, also was nice being able to message you on Facebook and get a reply.

titre: I'll Be Keeping My Phone Insurance Active FOR SURE Now!
comment: I had recently upgraded my iPhone with Verizon to the new SE and about 3 days later, the worst happened. I was using the restroom before leaving for a 3 day outdoor trip when my brand new phone slipped out of my pocket and into the toilet bowl. Shocked and panicked, I froze for a good 2-3 seconds before grabbing the bubbling iPhone. After 3.5 days of sitting in rice, the phone would not turn on or connect to power, upon which I had it looked at and it was concluded that the water damage was unfixable. Awesome. At this point I did not know what was going to be my situation and so walking back into Verizon in tears, they looked up my account and gave me the information for the insurance company. Asurion did an amazing job; all of the directions and requirements for turning in a broken phone were clear and concise, their customer support via phone call was phenomenal with knowledgable employees on the other line, and the process was so quick and effortless that I would never think twice about NOT having phone insurance. Thanks again Asurion!

titre: Great service; Although the phones all have issues that they send you.
comment: I was so impressed with how easy it was dealing with Assurion. They literally get you a replacement phone immediately. My disappointment is I had severe issues with the first replacement phone they sent me. The software must have had a glitch or virus. It was like the phone was possessed.  They immediately sent me a replacement phone. This time I had trouble downloading my information from the cloud because the version was so old. Now my issue is when I try to answer a call, it doesn't allow me to swipe and I keep missing calls.  Also, since I downloaded IOS 10, many of my apps crash.  Not happy.  I never had any issues with my original phone.

expensive considering I pay 11 bucks a month for each of my 5 devices then to have to pay $150+ for a replacement is ridiculous but customer service was great!!

My experience with asurion has always been good. They deliver quick and give exactly what you need. I will say I think the deductible is higher than it should be. As an Insurance Company it's to be expected I guess tho.
Quick and painless (except for my wallet)

titre: Busted iPhone replaced in a few days.
comment: replaced my iPhone because it had been dropped and the entire front was spiderwebbed. I think I had my new phone in 3 days.  Returning the old phone was a simple procedure. Changed one setting, sealed it in the provided envelope and dropped it in the mail.  Would have been 5/5 stars, but it did cost me $200 still (much cheaper than replacing the phone myself though).
Very quick turn-around, I was up and running extremely fast.  Thank you!  No problems in the least.

:) it was at my door the next day as promised

will recommend this company to anyone.

Process was simple and easy.  Phone came quickly.  Only reason i didn't rate it 5 stars is because they dropped my insurance after we used it.  When I got the insurance on my sons phone, i was told we could use it twice per year.  My son lost his phone once and it was stolen a second time.  After the second claim, they dropped us.  I was under the impression that we just couldn't use it again until a year had passed, but that was not the case, they just sent a letter saying that they had dropped us.

titre: I don't like the high copay but better than buying a whole new phone

This phone dose the same thing.. one wonders if paying insurance for a contracted term and yet I still had to pay $149.00 to get a refurbished phone .. pretty ridiculous.. and now they won't insure me after 2 claims... I don't get it..
Fast, efficient, trouble-free

titre: Total it cost me $469 b/c deductible was $199
comment: I ended up paying more than the phones value at the time I used the insurance. I won't keep insurance on a phone for more than 12 months from now on. $11/mo X 24 months plus $199. $469 all together to replace phone worth $300. Not good. As phone ages and premiums are paid deductibles should decrease.
Hassle free!
Everything went through as scheduled.
Very easy; received phone next day with complete instructions!
This was a third of the cost of my phone when it was new for a reconditioned phone!
Fast and accurate.

I got it the next day

I am always little leery about "insurances" but since the phone was for my 16 year old son I thought it a good idea.  He was at a store when his phone was stolen, I did all the necessary and easy paperwork and received the phone within 24 hours, visited the local Verizon store once I received it and they set it up for me very quickly.  I was impressed.

Would use again

Quick easy and painless
Everything was so great.easy to file and service was outstanding . thanks
Love that my replacement phone arrives the next day and works.

It was a bit cumbersome to fill out the form. At first Verizon told me to go to the store and it would be replaced. Not true! They said they did not replace phones and did not have this model. While I was there, I had Verizon call Asurion to request a new phone. I had completed an application on line (so I thought) but there was another half of hour of questions. It cost $149 to replace the phone which was overheating (remind you of the Samsung 7) through no fault of mine.They did send another phone 2 days later (because it was a week-end) and I spent about an hour at the Verizon store getting it to work. When I went outside, I could not make a call. They accused me of doing something to it (which I did not). The sim card Verizon used was bad and they replaced it. Also, the phone was not fully charged and I did not realize that so that was another complication. I was going to someplace that I had never been and I had no phone and no GPS (except that I also travel with a Tom Tom and was able to work things out).It took a few days until all my apps were working again although I still have trouble connecting my phone to the car blue tooth.However, all in all, not having to spend $600 on another phone makes it worthwhile.Also, I have stopped using a case and the phone stays cool.
I've had Asurion covering my phones for years, and have always been very satisfied with their service.
In less than 18 hrs I had my new phone. Very satisfied!
I received my device the next day
Got my new phone when promised. No delays!
Very fast thank you for your help and support for the phone.
Service was good EXCEPT for my phone being out of stock and having to wait.
